title: Chowkidar Pankaj Mishra
subtitle:

title: Tahir Qadiry طاهر قادرى
subtitle: Tonight marked a historic day in our mission in India. We celebrated in an atmosphere of love & unity under 1 roof with some 2,000 Afghan refugees, students, traders, our Sikh community etc. There was music, dance, food. Kudos to my brilliant team. More pics & videos coming soon pic.twitter.com/2KbBJVPNof

title: Year 6 | The Arbor School
subtitle: A powerful poem written by one of the year 6  students. We read the poem ‘Free’ and used this poem as inspiration to write our own poem about a young child who becomes refugee. This links to our current project: ‘Moving People’.  #PowerfulPoetry #ProudTeacherpic.twitter.com/jscbQv6Jhp

title: Disruptive Signal
subtitle: If MSM Wants to Talk About Iran & "Migrants", So talk About the 1 million refugees living in Iran, resulting from the US and EU military invasions and how these Refugees are living in houses rather than in concentration camps without sanitation and made with tents like in Europe! pic.twitter.com/xA4PJpaomZ

title: UNHCR Pakistan
subtitle: Today, UNHCR's External Relations Officer @mc_poirier and Spokesperson @qaiserafridi exchange views on local refugee situation and #RAHAprogramme with the @Mayor_Karachi ahead of the first major meeting on refugees #GlobalRefugeeForum in December. @Refugees pic.twitter.com/yorBCf5e9W

title: Chowkidar Pankaj Mishra
subtitle:
Floods came.They changed the land.

Cyclones came.They adapted.

Landslides came.They showed their resilience.

Water was scarce.They deployed solar-powered pumps.

Rohingya refugees have become #ClimateAction pros.

Awareness of Climate Action + Flood's +Disaster'spic.twitter.com/1CJPWBnEmb

title: UNAMI
subtitle:
Special Representative of the United Nations Secretary-General for #Iraq, Ms. Jeanine Hennis-Plasschaert, visited Bardarash camp on 23 October. The camp in Dohuk Governorate recently reopened to host incoming refugees from #Syria.
